reviews.text: Not only the best steak in Tallinn, but the best I have had in any city or country (recent comparisons from Italy, Frace, Spain, Sweden). My favorite here is the rib-eye steak with mushroom sauce and mashed potatoes with blue mold cheese. The quality of meat is very high and consistent (have been around 10 times and never disappointed). Keep up the good work!

Located by the Old Town City gates, this place has a good selection of beef cuts for your desired steak. A but on the pricy side and that‚Äôs because of location.

I got the burger ‚Äî basic dish to test out any grill house! And this place did a good job. The beef was cooked to medium and remained juicy. Server was attentive and polite. If I go back, I will probably get a proper steak. You should too!
Good food , big portion , nice place . Front VIRU  gate

Been going to Helsinki Goodwin for years and the experience has been quite enjoyable, you get what you paid for, so for a date night we decided to try the Tallinn one instead of going for a steak to Argentina like we always did.

Agree with many reviewers, service was sub-par. The only booking system, don't know if it works or not cuz I didn't receive any information after. Called the receptionist and they slammed the phone after getting reservation time, number of people and name. Didn't even bother with a thank you or a confirmation.

We went there anyways, table service took ages. Order 220g but received 300g steak instead. They didn't even ask which sauce we wanted. While paying, it was our first time in Europe that the waiter asked for tips, twice.

Knowing that tipping culture isn't necessary in Estonia, though we still would've if it was a good service.

They'll live long due to location, but my search for the perfect steak restaurant in Tallinn continues =)

Most delicious. I ordered what the bloke at the table next to us had. He had superb tasteüëçüëçüëçüòã. A rib eye steak with fries and a salad . You cannot go wrong. The waiter was also superb and gave just the right amount of attention  without being overbearing. Well done Goodwins
